column4: *cough* can someone help me with a really dumb question? I'm trying to install gnome tweak and I don't know how to install things without my software manager...
sudo apt-get install gnome-tweak-tool
it can't locate it. Where should I put it so it can locate it?
press "ctrl alt T" to bring up a terminal. then enter the command
heh, I know to put it in terminal. Terminal's telling me it can't locate the package XP
then you need to update the repo ?
the repo?
sudo apt-get update
ok
still can't locate it... should I take it out of downloads?
heh, ok done that twice. Thanks though
does not work ?
im pretty sure the package is gnome-tweak-tool. check http://www.ubuntugeek.com/gnome-tweak-tool-a-tool-for-changing-specialised-or-advanced-gnome3-settings.html
oic. I'll just do what that says
then just find it and install
it's still unable to locate it...
am I not meant to press enter after each line?
enter those 3 commands seperatedly and in that order
I did that. i must be doing something wrong, it keeps giving me the same goddamn error
then google "install gnome-tweak-tool" and try different methods
I might just ask my dad
